channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 2 E-Bikes on Foreshore, 19th February
item.description:
Two abandoned Voi e-bikes are currently located on the River Thames foreshore (South Bank), directly below the stone stairs next to Doggett's Coat and Badge (1 Blackfriars Bridge, SE1 9UD). They were spotted at 20:28 on Thursday, 19th Feb. The bikes are below the high-tide line and at risk of being submerged or swept away, which poses an environmental hazard due to the batteries. Immediate recovery is required before the next high tide.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Blackfriars Bridge, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: North section of Honiton Road, 19th February
item.description:
Series of 5 or 6 quite deep pot holes that can’t be seen by cyclists or cars at night until it’s too late . They are providing a danger in particular to cyclists but also to motorists’ vehicles. You can see there has been partial patching before (fairly recently) that has failed but urgently needs remedial action.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Honiton Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Continous Illegal Parking outside 111 Bar, 19th February
item.description:
Despite continous reports there is still copious illegal parking at all times of the day. It is creating large amounts of loud traffic on a residential road and routinely blocks the cycleway on Hertford Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Hertford Road, Edmonton

item.title: The public clock in Blue Market Square has stopped and is no longer showing the correct time. It likely just needs a battery replacement. Please could the council arrange maintenance?, 19th February
item.description:
